title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
so I have this one 820-3476 which came in dead, no pp5v_s4, so I try to reflow smc, now the board came to life, does a looping cut out chime ( not complete chime)
tried all flex unconnected, no chime, and I sort it one by one, the culprit is the lcd, when I plugged it in, the chime loop came, but if not connected, it only chime once, already tried changing lcd connector, still the same..

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message: update : just realize the efi chip is maybe changed, its called mxic or something, it doesnt belong there is it

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
I use 820-3476a for 820-3476-06 because I don;t have similard board, the board can boot to windows 10, but very slow loading mac os, so it must be from the same exact board ?
sorry Im still a beginner at this type of work, do I just need to clean the me region then ?

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
I didn't exactly understand.
Do you change BIOS file, or swap BIOS chip from other board?
In both cases, ME region MUST be cleaned...

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
Mistype, I mean mxic at the comment above
I swap the chip from another board.. Is there any tutorial on how to clean me region?
I heard there's a manual way to clean me region too?
Whats the essential equipment to do these?

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
You can clean it manually with any hex editor and correct Flash Image Tool from Intel.
If you plan to work Apple stuff, get Medusa programmer.
Can do the job very fast for you; as many more things too.

In the mean time, upload the BIOS file somwhere, so we can clean it for you.
I suppose you made backup of your original BIOS chip.

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
i see, I think I'd take the medusa soon, how do I get the bios file ? fyi, jtag removed..
and I don't have reference to another working 820-3476-06, so Idk if the efi chip is already changed or not.., is it the mxic one, or the other one? or it doesnt matter, because you can just reflash it or something ?

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
Should be good if you still have original chip.
You need to read it and check if still has original serial number on it.
If not, we build new one from the chip you've got the board started.

Remove U6100 and read it with an USB programmer.
We have various posts about how to read such chip without a special adapter.
[URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/search?q=wson8&searchJSON=%7B%22keywords%22%3A%22wson8%22%7D"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/sea...%22wson8%22%7D[/URL]

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
awesome, got medusa 3, and cleanme do the trick!
no more looping chime with / without lcd connected, now only no backlight

title: 820-3476-06 looping chime when lcd connected
message:
Do you get image, only missing backlight?
Did you try known good "compatible" LCD assembly?
